flawed_nl_solution:
If in six years Xavier will be 30 years old, he is 30-6 = <<30-6=24>>24 years old now.
If Xavier is twice as old as Yasmin, Yasmin is 24/2 = <<24/2=21>>21 years old.
The total of their ages now is 21+24 = <<21+24=45>>45 years
#### 45

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 21. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
